references.formattedCitation: Hansen, Mogens Herman, and Thomas Heine Nielsen. An Inventory of Archaic and Classical Poleis. Oxford: Oxford University Press, 2004. http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/252695579.

description: An important city of Magna Graecia, Metapontum was located on the Gulf of Tarentum. The Achaeans were responsible for its foundation, perhaps as early as the eighth century B.C.

properties.description: 1:500,000 scale representative point location digitized from the Barrington Atlas of the Greek and Roman World by the Digital Atlas of Roman and Medieval Civilizations project at Harvard University.

names.description: Pantanello is located in the chora of Metaponto, just below the slopes of the first major terrace of the territory. It is roughly halfway between the city and an important rural sanctuary at San Biagio.
